page.title: 05INTERVIEW AT WHITEHILL.
page.content: Interview with a nonagenarian. " When did you come to Greenloaning?" "I came here in 1945." "What was it like then,have there been many changes?" "There were few houses.Whitehill used to be a farm with a shop at the end that sold everything.The station has closed down,so has the inn,the flour mill and the fruit farm." "What did the fruit farm grow?" "They grew raspberries & strawberries, school children used to earn pocket money by picking the fruit." "How has our school changed?" "There was only one teacher and about a dozen pupils who sat in rows at desks,not round tables like you." "Is the population larger or smaller?" "It is about the same. Families were bigger then,so though there were fewer houses the populations about the same.
